text: Pristis aquitanicus is an extinct species of sawfish in the family Pristidae. It lived in the Neogene era in France, Portugal, Florida, and India. It lived in marine, bays, and estuaries. It was a nektobenthic carnivore. == References == Category:Fossil taxa described in 1871 aquitanicus Category:Fossils of India Category:Fossils of France Category:Prehistoric fish of North America
title: Pristis aquitanicus
